author: news24.com
title: Prisoners verses Pensioners. Who is the underdog?
text:
I would like Carte Blanche to investigate why it cost R300.00 per day to keep a prisoner in prison, three meals a day, TV cell phones, computer lessons Education sport a roof over their heads.
While the SASSA Pensioners get an amount of R46.00 a day to live on. I am not including the child grants or disablity grants.
The pensioners were the ones that worked for this country, and now they have to live on a couple of slices of bread and some jam a day, cant afford to pay the electricity costs, unable to have hot bath's even unable to cook.
They have to depend on others to live, Like I do, with the help of my family, but if I did not have them, at 70 there would be no chance of me getting another job.
I was a nurse at one time. and worked in the government hospitals all my life. and this is the thanks I get from the government. I want this looked into as soon as possible.
Thank you on the behalf of all Pensioners in South Africa.
